quest.name: Elation and Trepidation
journal: Yugiri is eager to see Gosetsu safely back to their master.
objectives: Speak with the Liberation Front sentry.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I confess, I have never had much cause to consider the state of my personal finances...until now. Confound it...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: He's absolutely mortified, isn't he! Well, maybe he'll think twice before making his next grand gesture. If he ever missed an opportunity to show me how much more mature and responsible he is, I'd sympathize. I mean, I do, to a point─but that doesn't mean I'm about to let him forget this.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Another time, Tsuyu. Our path takes us in a different direction.

dialogue.name: YOTSUYU
dialogue.text: Are we going to that village? They might have dango!

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: We must meet with Lord Hien as soon as possible─though mayhap not at the enclave...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: I will send word requesting that he receive us at the House of the Fierce, where there are fewer prying eyes.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: If all are in agreement, I shall scout ahead and see that the way is clear. Pray follow as swiftly as you are able, and join me on the outskirts of Namai.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: All is well?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Good. The others are hiding nearby. Let us proceed─quietly, if you please.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you for delivering Gosetsu back to us in one piece. We are lucky indeed to have friends who would journey to the other side of the world to help us─and repeatedly, at that.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We have much and more to think upon, but as regards the Empire, we can but watch and wait.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Now then, seeing as you've come all this way, you must allow me to show you around the enclave. I would not have you thinking we've been idle in your absence.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The rebuilding effort proceeds apace, I'm pleased to say, and we are now ready to welcome home our countrymen who were displaced by the war. Should they so desire it, there is a place here for those who fled to Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We should be delighted to accept your invitation, Lord Hien. And I have no doubt that your subjects at Revenant's Toll will be heartened to hear that their lord has not forgotten them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Oh, it's nothing. I just thought that Gosetsu and Yugiri would be back by now.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Forgive me, my lord, but Captain Jifuya is nowhere to be found.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Oh? He was here when I arrived.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: For now, we have taken Yotsuyu to a private chamber and assigned another to watch over her, my lord. But I find it passing strange that the captain should leave his post with nary a word.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That does seem most unusual. If you mean to look for the man, we would be happy to assist you.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: We should be glad of the help. While I search without, mayhap you could ask our soldiers here if they know anything.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I will join you.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: With respect, my lord, you should remain here. Should the Empire move against us, you will be better able to coordinate our response.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Hah! And there I was thinking I was in charge... But you have the right of it. Go on, then. I will mind the House.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It should come as no surprise, but a number of the soldiers here were unsettled by Yotsuyu's arrival. Thankfully, Lord Hien was able to put their minds at ease. For now.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: We must find Jifuya, and quickly. His disappearance would be cause to worry at the best of times, but that it should coincide with our arrival is more worrying still.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: All here know Jifuya well. His movements will not have gone unnoticed.

dialogue.name: HANAME
dialogue.text: You seek the captain? He passed by a little while ago.

dialogue.name: HANAME
dialogue.text: I, uh... I wondered if I should tell someone, as it happens. He did not look well, you see. I asked if aught was the matter and he told me the past had caught up with him. But I doubt it was that. There are older men in our ranks.

dialogue.name: KAIDATE
dialogue.text: Captain Jifuya? He was headed for the northern entrance when I saw him last. I was going to invite him to train with us, but he did not hear me call out to him.

dialogue.name: KAIDATE
dialogue.text: If you need him, I daresay the sentry on duty will be able to tell you more. Indeed, I suggested as much to Mistress Alisaie when she came asking earlier. Is something amiss?

dialogue.name: HANAME
dialogue.text: If Captain Jifuya is unwell, it has nothing to do with the past catching up with him, whatever he may think. I should have said as much when he passed by...

dialogue.name: KAIDATE
dialogue.text: As I keep saying, Captain Jifuya was headed for the northern entrance when I last saw him. If you wish to know where he went after that, you could do worse than ask the sentry on duty.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It should come as no surprise, but a number of the soldiers here were unsettled by Yotsuyu's arrival. Thankfully, Lord Hien was able to put their minds at ease. For now.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: All here know Jifuya well. His movements will not have gone unnoticed.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I see the trail led you here as well. This man says he saw Jifuya leave.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCE03025
dialogue.text: Aye, the captain went outside some few bells ago─and looking quite unwell, I am sorry to say. This I mentioned to Lord Gosetsu, who straightways struck out after him. I hope they will be all right...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Gosetsu too? It seems everyone is bent on joining the search.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That's all well and good, but someone has to stay behind. There's no telling what the Empire is plotting.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You go on, Forename. Alphinaud and I shall hold the fort.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Alisaie has apprised me of the situation. Leave the House to us and focus on the search.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Yotsuyu appears to be behaving herself─for now.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: So Jifuya went for some fresh air, did he? Whatever his business may be, I hope you find him soon.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The captain went outside looking quite unwell. Lord Gosetsu has since gone to find him.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: He does not appear to have come this way...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: So Jifuya did venture outside. Wherever he is, he cannot yet have gone far.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Have you not seen Yugiri? We need everyone present, and urgently.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Jifuya can't be the only one here with a mortal fear of Yotsuyu. She tormented these people.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Gosetsu told me Jifuya's tale. His past conduct was...regrettable. But the man has served the Liberation Front with distinction for years, and that should not be forgotten. He will have his new post.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Hm? Was Yugiri not with you?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Forgive me, now is not the time for brooding. Come, let us rejoin the others.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Everyone is here. Good. There have been developments that demand our immediate attention.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Jifuya can't be the only one here with a mortal fear of Yotsuyu. She tormented these people.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: That her mere presence should sow such strife...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien and Master Alphinaud look troubled... Something is afoot.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I thank you for your help in the search. Gosetsu has told me all that transpired.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I would not presume to defend the life Jifuya led before he joined the Front. Nor will I condemn it. Frankly, it is not my place to judge. I will only say this: the Jifuya I know has ever been a man of courage. That he should feel driven to flee bespeaks the depth of his terror. Even now, Yotsuyu casts a shadow over the realm...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But the question of what is to be done with her must wait. The Empire is on the move once more.
